H0.text: Decrease is the most likely outcome for the number of plants and animals living in the area where a large amount of oil was spilled in a lake environment within a few weeks.

H1.text: Increase is the most likely effect on the number of plants and animals living in the area where a large amount of oil was spilled in a lake environment within a few weeks.

H2.text: The number of plants and animals in the area where a large amount of oil was spilled in a lake environment will most likely remain the same within a few weeks.

A3.text: Chemical alterations include changes in the loading rates of biostimulatory nutrients, oxygen-consuming materials, and toxins.

A4.text: The environmental history of the Great Lakes of North America illustrates this problem, particularly how multiple stresses, such as water pollution, over-harvesting and invasive species can combine.

A5.text: Corexit increased the toxicity of the oil by 52 times.

A6.text: Over 1 million birds died directly from the oil spill.

A7.text: Immediate effects include the deaths of between 100,000 and 250,000 seabirds.
